Reviews.Title: Best TV for the budget
Reviews.Author: Ramesh
Reviews.Content: I got this TV on Feb 23 from Costco, now after using for about one month I say this is my Best TV. I had Samsung 40E5050 which too I liked very much. But there was probably some technical issue....that would sometimes produce spark like sound,so I returned that TV. The Costco in my place didn't have that Samsung TV anymore. Since Samsung was very good for me as per picture and sound and price....I couldn't decide which to buy now. Then I saw this Sony Bravia 40R450A (2013model) for unbelievable price. I had always thought of buying Sony but didn't buy because of price. But this 40" led Sony is priced unreasonably low, price is comparable to other brands whereas the quality....its very high !!The picture is simply amazing and there are various preset modes to select or one can manually set his own preferences. I have not changed any picture setting though.Though 60hz, it has Motion Flow of 120. so I think it is comparable to 120hz TV of other brands. There is significant improvement in judder which I used to get in my previous TV.I use indoor antenna and don't ask me how good is the reception of this TV. I really recommend this TV for those who use indoor antenna....I can get so many channels now, that too very clear. This one has the best reception when compared to my previous Samsung and JVC Black crystal.I use Roku with my TV and it has no issues.The TV is very slim and light. The bezel is very thin. it occupies little space.This TV also has fm in it but I haven't tried yet.For me its an useless feature.It is also smartphone enabled.DRAWBACKS:It has only 2 hdmi ports and has only one usb port which can be used to play photos, music and video(unlike Samsung, it supports very few video formats(xvid and avchd). whereas Samsung would support almost any video formats).OVERALL, I recommend this TV to anyone who want quality in low price.

Reviews.Title: When combined with other Sony (and Roku) products, this becomes perfect
Reviews.Author: B. Lee
Reviews.Content: What if you could get a high quality Sony smart television with access to Netflix, HBO Go, Hulu Plus, Pandora, and more... And what if it output sound to your receiver without needing any additional cables than the hdmi in you have plugged in already?  What if all this could be had for a shade over $500?Such is the case when this TV is combined with the Roku 3400R Streaming Stick.  Plug the stick into HDMI 2/MHL, and after a quick setup it's all controllable with the TV's remote.Even better, I also have a Sony STR-DH720 receiver and an older Sony BDP-S370 Blu-Ray Player.  First cool feature - HDMI-CEC/ARC.  This means the Roku outputs surround sound to the receiver without needing any cables.  Just use the Bravia Sync button on the remote to select TV speakers or the amplifier... Which it will automatically turn on and off as needed.  That's cool.  The blu ray player is also controllable through this menu, and the volume automatically adjusts the right input.So that's the cool feature stuff, but how is the TV compared to other sub-$500 40" sets?  Very competitive.  We compared this with a Toshiba 40l2200u and a Vizio 39" Smart model, both priced at $400.  The Toshiba is not competitive with either of these models.  The Vizio seems to have slightly better motion resolution but with less vibrant color capability and far worse sound.  Roku's streaming platform has more channels and is more stable than the one built by Vizio as well.  The Samsung 40" 5300 is the next best choice, but the Sony is more attractive (to me), sounds better, and I trust Sony gear more than Samsung.The only con I've discovered so far is some motion blur, primarily with cartoons.  Black eyeballs will pop up behind moving characters... I'm not sure if I can defeat this with a setting (there are lots!) but it's mild and only occasionally noticeable.PROS:Excellent out of box PQMHL port for streaming accessoriesARC for fewer cablesBetter than average flat panel soundPrice for Sony's rep and featuresBravia syncCONSMotion could be betterBezel, while nice and thin, is very shinyThis is the best TV in our house and the best I've seen in this price bracket.  Very, very easy recommendation.

What I love about it is when I turn a device ON, such as my BluRay Player, the switcher detects it and pushes that image to the screen - realizing that is why I turned it on - because I want to watch the BluRay player!! Genius! It even turns the TV ON if it was off. Although that may be a function of the SONY devices working in harmony rather than the switcher. Either way it's way cool.All this SONY equipment plus the Cable HD Box left me with 4 unique remotes. Aargh! The wife was not impressed. So, I purchased the SONY Universal Remote RM-VZ320 for about twenty bucks. And, voila!! Happy wife. Happy life!! The remote works great too! Pays to buy ALL SONY. Thanks SONY and AMAZON - a great combination!p.s. count up how many HDMI cables you'll need and order them at the same time from Amazon - great prices. Ask me how I know? Yep. Forgot to order all the cables. Doh!Set-up:SONY TV  - KDL50R450A 50-Inch 120Hz 1080p LED HDTV (Black)  $599SONY Blu-Ray Player - BDP-S570  $129 (see newer version: Sony BDP-S5100 3D Blu-ray  Disc Player with Wi-Fi for $89 on Amazon)SONY SoundBar - HTCT260 Sound Bar Home Theater System  $299SONY Univ Remote - RM-VZ320  $20Switcher - Portta PET0301S 3x1 HDMI Switcher with 3D Support  $10  Total System Approx  $1,000  :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV! (50" Version: KDL-50R450A)
Reviews.Author: WARRZONE
Reviews.Content: This TV has a fantastic picture. The direct LED backlight prevents any uniformity issues. The Motion Flow XR 120 works and is sufficient for games, movies, or other entertainment. I did not have to mess around with the advanced picture settings in the menu. I ended up leaving it on Standard mode. The TV styling (build) and menu styling (interface) are very nice. The TV is well-built and does not feel cheap, and the stand is not flimsy.I'll include my selection process in case you're interested. My suggestion would be find out what your requirements are, and then, try to find a TV that fits your budget.I measured how far away I sit from the TV and found the sceen size I needed. Here's a chart for reference:Screen Size Recommended Range35" 3.5' - 5.0' (1.0 - 1.5 m)40" 4.0' - 6.0' (1.2 - 1.8 m)50" 5' - 7.5' (1.5 - 2.2 m)60" 6.0' - 9.0' (1.8 - 2.7 m)I did not want a Plasma because of the energy use, heat output, dim in well lit rooms, burn-in potential, irreparability/or very costly, etc. I know most people have great plasma sets, but I did not want or have the money to fool with it for a little better blacks and contrast. Plus, the plasmas weren't any cheaper, but they did have the "smart" function.I did not need a Smart TV since they typically have a clumsy interface, and it drives up the price. Updates are slow and their app selection is more limited than boxes like Roku or Apple TV with Airplay. I use my Xbox 360 and soon my PS4 for apps anyway.I did not need a 3D TV, which I see as more of a gimmick. Would it be nice to have? Sure, but not for $250 more. Converted TV programming is not worth it. It is hard to get real HD content on Blu-Ray, and even then, HD stereoscopic 3D is best viewed on a 100"+ quality screen (my preference is silver) using a good projector ($1500+) with at least 1k lumens (most have more than that now anyway).As a rule, I don't buy budget brands because the quality is usually not up to par. Toshiba and LG have had perfomance reviews recently (i.e. their stated high refresh rate seems to help nothing, black levels are bad, and well-lit room image quality is bad). I had a Sharp die on me, so that left my choice between Sony, Samsung, and Panasonic. Samsung and Panasonic were overpriced. That left Sony. Sony had one that fit my budget.I mentioned some of the positive aspects of this TV, so now I will list the few negative apects of this TV that I have found. The corners are a little dark, but they are barely noticeable unless there is one color across the screen. It's much better than flashlighting that some edge-lit models have. The sound quality of the speakers is similar to that of all flat-screen TV speakers, so I had to get a sound bar (HTCT260H). This isn't a negative, but Bravia Sync works well (HDMI CEC). The TV only has 1 true HDMI port. It's a good thing it has ARC, so no HDMI output is really necessary. The other HDMI port is shared with MHL on the left side of the TV, which I did not know before I bought it. I thought I was getting 2 stand-alone HDMI inputs + 1 MHL port. The only one HDMI input in the back situation makes my decision for me on how to set up the cables -- I will be running everything into a switcher, then into the sound bar, and then into the TV (using high speed HDMI cables). The remote does not have a dedicated settings button. This means I have to take extra steps and press "Home" and scroll down and select "Settings." However, there is a sort of dumbed down settings menu called "Options" which does have a button on the remote. Also, I'd prefer the remote to be backlit and have bluetooth capabilities (to control PS3, PS4, iPhone, etc). I may have to get a Logitech universal remote eventually.The positives, by far, outweigh the negatives (more like minor annoyances). This is a no-nonsense TV, and for the street price of $599, this TV cannot be beat!NOTE: At the time of writing this review, the Sony store says that this TV is no longer available. They were in stock just last week. I wonder if they are sold out, or if the TVs are discontinued so early. Sony should bring them back if that's the case. If you cannot get this TV, the closest thing to it I would recommend would be the Panasonic TC-L50E60 (street price: $699-$799). It is a little more expensive because of its "smart" functions, but its "smart" functions are more extensive than most.EDIT 9/14/2013: It turns out the TV is too popular. It was not discontinued, it sold out. It is back in stock in the Sony store for $599. Don't overpay the Amazon third party sellers. Hopefully, Amazon will get it back in stock soon too.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Marvelous
Reviews.Author: Javier
Reviews.Content: I own a Pioneer Kuro PDP-5080 HD, so that's my point of reference. The most important part of any television is it's ability to reproduce accurate color and black levels. Smart features, internet connectivity, etc. are all ancillary features that don't affect the monitors ability to display a realistic picture to faithfully reproduce the TV/Movies that you are watching. The Sony KDL-40R450A is an absolutely stunning television. It's black levels are the best I have seen on on any LCD. It's color reproduction in cinema picture mode is perfect. With any television it's the quality of the source that really affects the image most. With some reference Blu-rays, "There Will be Blood" "Blade Runner" "Apocalypto" the image is as good as the Kuro. That's not to say side by side you can't tell the difference, but when viewed independently the Sony holds it's own and I don't find myself noticing the difference.I know most people don't watch OTA TV anymore but with a basic antenna I can pick up all the local channels in HD. Sunday football comes in perfectly. Sony really nailed it when it comes to editing channels. It never blasts you with static if you land on a bad channel it simply shows a blue screen and says no signal. You can easily browse the spectrum and hide b.s. channels you don't want. QAM works marvelously as well. Menu's are pretty if not the most intuitive.Aside from it's stunning image the TV has beautiful industrial design. It's narrow bezel, simple stand, and branding are all understated. It looks expensive and feels very well built. It's light enough for one person to move around.If you want netflix, hbogo, hulu, and streaming buy an Apple TV or Roku. The menu and capabilities of those devices are much more refined and advanced than any built into a TV.The only downside I can see for some users is connectivity. It has only two HDMI ports and one component. This is a bit of a hindrance if you have lots of devices, plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Sony TV.
Reviews.Author: oibv305
Reviews.Content: I have always purchased Sony tvs and have always been satisfied. For some reason, I saw a Samsung 40" at Sears and decided to order one like it from Amazon. After doing some research and discovering that Samsung was putting cheap Sharp panels (or worse, Chimea panels) on their tvs I found that I could determine whether the tv I received was truly a Samsung tv with a Samsung panel like the one I saw at Sears, or one with the cheaper panel. Sure enough, the Samsung tv I received from Amazon had a cheap Sharp panel, so I returned it to Amazon. I explained to the Amazon rep what the problem was and I wanted a Samsung tv with a Samsung panel, he said he understood and would ship me another tv right away. When I took the tv out of the box, once again it had a Sharp panel, not a Samsung. I asked for return authorization and sent it back, again explaining to the rep why I was returning it. Next thing I know Amazon said I could not order another. When Samsung was caught installing the cheap panels on its tvs it made national news, but  Amazon seemed to be completely in the dark, which is kind of hard to believe since many of the reviews clearly stated that people knew they had received Samsung tvs with the cheaper panels on them from Amazon. After reading several reviews on this Sony tv I decided to order it instead. I am completely satisfied with this tv, the picture is just as good, if not better, than the Samsung, and I am wondering why I ever decided to go with the Samsung to begin with. It dawned on me that if a company like Samsung is willing to cheat its customers then I do not want to be buying their products because I no longer know what I am getting. I highly recommend this Sony 40" tv!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture!
Reviews.Author: R. Edwards
Reviews.Content: I will begin by saying that I am very picky about the accuracy of my TV,  I was pleasantly surprised to find that my Sony TV was very well calibrated, right out of the box.  This is one of the most accurately calibrated displays I have seen at its default settings.  The only adjusting I did was to change the mode to standard mode and set the white balance to neutral.  Everything else was spot-on.  The skin tones are right on the money. The contrast is perfect.  Also, Sony did a great job with their dynamic contrast enhancer.  It works much better than Samsungs (which isn't very dynamic).  However, for movies, I would turn this setting to low or off. This is my fist Sony, and I am impressed! My previous TVs have been Samsungs, but the last one I bought (UN37EH5000) had such a lousy calibration out the the box, I became frustrated with it and finally returned it.  Faces were purplish-red and no amount of adjusting could make it even come close to the Sony.  White balance calibration helped but the only way to fix the Samsung would be with a professional calibration using the service menu.  I realize that most TVs require a professional calibration.  However, I think manufacturers should be able to at least get the calibration in the ball-park. I applaud Sony for doing an excellent job with this one.Added 9/4/13 - I continue to love this TV.  There is one feature that I wish it had - an over the air electronic programming guide (EPG).  This TV only shows the information for the current program. According to Federal law, broadcasters MUST include program guide information as part of the ATSC standard.  However, TV manufacturers have no obligation to make it available to viewers.  This is where Samsung really shines.  Samsung TVs show program information up to 12 hours in advance.  You can read detailed information about the show and even program the TV to change to the channel when the show starts.  Some television manufacturers have apparently chosen to cripple this feature. In so doing, they're tilting the playing field in favor of cable or satellite TV purveyors. It's almost comical, but my new Sony requires its clock to be set manually. Yet the current time is embedded within the ATSC signal and is provided once every second!  That's absolutely ridiculous!  My Samsung sets its clock from the broadcast signal.All I can say is this:  Come on, Sony!  Climb aboard the bandwagon! You are already extracting the information for the current program.  Pay your programmers to develop some code to extract the rest of the information into nice on-screen programming guide. Then you can use the code on all of your TVs.  As more and more people get frustrated with exorbitant cable prices and discover that they can get superior HD quality over the air, they will be switching.  Seems like you would want to position your products to capture that market.  While you are at it, give us a signal strength meter too.  Again all of my Samsungs have one.  Heck, even my Radio Shack converter box that I got years ago when broadcast TV went digital, has an EPG and a signal strength meter. Really, you guys can do better...

Reviews.Title: awesome gaming tv :)
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I bought this mainly as an upgrade from my Samsung 32" 720p tv.  All I can really say after having this tv after 2 days is that I freaking love it.  Out of the box the standard picture needed no tweaking other than needing to set the brightness back a little bit for darker blacks.  I mainly use this tv for gaming and Netflix.  Running on my ps3 games like borderlands 2 and Ni no Kuni look fantastic but some games that are up scaled a bit more have a lot of strange pixelation, but its mainly because the tv is trying to guess the pixel color I'm guessing, but games still look great.  On my ps4 though battlefield 4 and FIFA 14 look just amazing to say the least.  Particle effects and explosions are insane and I've had my girlfriend walk in while I was playing FIFA. And she thought it was an actual game before inspecting closer.  Granted these games look great by themselves but on this tv they were even better.  Also watching movies look great the colors seem to be spot on and textures look great, also with the size upgrade from my last tv allows me to notice a lot more detail.  The only complaint I have about this tv is the sound.  The two 8 watt speakers don't really do much to impress.  I'd recommend getting a sound bar or a full system but I mainly use my headset for gaming and just turn the volume up when watching tv or movies. Also it doesn't have a built in surround sound like my old Samsung.  All in all though I think this is a pretty kickass TV for the price and can even compete with some other tvs hundreds of dollars more.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV! BUY IT!

Reviews.Content: GREAT TV! GREAT PICTURE. i hooked up the tv yesterday and it is a great machine. i recommend the 50 inch for your living room. very crisp image and also very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Flatscreen HD Television

Reviews.Content: It arrived on time and was expertly packaged.  It was very easy to unpack and set up.  I found the connection aspects of the TV to be simple.  What is stunning about this unit is the LED picture.  Wow.  I have purchased a 40 inch LCD unit for my wife and it has been excellent, but this LED picture is jaw dropping.  The Picture Adjustment screen is easy to manipulate, and it took me about two days of fussing with it to get it perfect.  (it was very good out of the box, but I am fussy).  The detail that can be observed on HD transmissions is superb.  I have DirecTV and frequently get 1920 x 1080 resolution.  The television was immediately connected to a Visio Soundbar underneath, so I can't speak about the sound.  I don't see how you can get better television than this.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Oh My Gosh!!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the Money
Reviews.Author: texan_176@yahoo.com
Reviews.Content: When looking to buy a new TV for a bedroom I researched many models and brands.  You can get all of the technical specs for it from the internet or from SONY.  The most attractive thing about this TV is the simplicity.  Since it lacks wifi the menus are ultra easy to understand and navigate.  Mine was purchased for a primary user who is over 70 years old and not too tech savvy.  He got the hang of it within 10 minutes.  Setup out of the box is very easy.  You run 2 philips screws snug in the base to attach it to the screen assembly and it is ready to go.  There are only 3 screens you see before you start to watch TV.  The first screen asks what language you prefer, the second is to set the date and time, and the last screen scans the over the air channels for self programming.  Once this is done the TV will start playing on the lowest number formerly VHF channel. The TV has the usual audio and video settings you would expect.The default settings are really good as is but you can fine tune things.  The speakers are really good for how small they are to be able to fit into the assembly.  There is no rich bass as is expected with speakers of this size.  I ran an external amplified sound system to get better sound quality.  To do this you can use the optical audio output or simply run a 3.5mm cable from the female port on the TV.  The only thing that keeps me from giving this TV 5 star is the design of the remote.  I have owned Samsung and LG TVs that were more expensive and less expensive but all of them had better remotes in terms of design and function.  The plastic the remote is made of is on the cheap side and looks sort of like X-brand electronics grade of materials.  The buttons are also on the small side and very close together.  If you have large hands this could be a problem.  Also, when you change channels you have to input a minimum of 3 characters.  You put in the main channel number, push the dot button, and enter the subchannel number.  The TV will reset from the input of buttons to the current channel within 3-5 seconds if you are not pushing a button.  The combination of the small buttons and short idle time is problematic for someone like the primary user of my TV.  Keep this in mind if you are a senior citizen.Initially I was hesitating to buy the TV because it lacked wifi but I decided I would buy an external box to stream video from services such as Netflix or Amazon.  However, if you read reviews of smart TVs you see many complaints about slow loading video, poor quality, or freezing.  This is due to processors that can not keep up with the quantity of data in HD programming.  The life expectancy of a TV is usually 4-7 years in most cases with normal use.  As data keeps growing and becomes more demanding your built in processor will become more and more obsolete.  The best alternative is a box such as Apple TV or Roku.  I will be getting an Apple TV with this Sony since that box can be used with a bluetooth keyboard I already have to input search queries instead of using a remote like a wireless mouse to click on an on screen QWERTY board.  I have had the TV a few weeks and so far so good. I will update this if something notable happens with the SONY.It should also be noted that this TV in made in Mexico and not China like the majority of the TVs on the market.  This is a huge plus point.

Reviews.Title: Great for gaming
Reviews.Author: Ric Brown
Reviews.Content: I primarily use my TV for gaming and the occasional Blu-ray movie, and the picture on this set is incredible. I can see textures that I couldn't before on my last TV, and dark scenes look great and are rendered in impressive clarity. There are a load of different minute adjustments you can make to the picture, but the standard modes (called scenes) have been so good that I haven't even needed to make any further adjustments this far. The only downsides are that the set only has two HDMI ports, and the component and composite ports are joined into one. I have all of my devices hooked up to a receiver though, so this isn't really a problem for me. I also have a surround sound set hooked up to the TV, so I'm unable to comment on sound of the actual TV speakers.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture for the Price!
Reviews.Author: VQT
Reviews.Content: Got this for our loft area that gets lots of sun & mixed usage from viewing TV to playing PS3.The picture is outstanding as expected from a Sony.The depth of the TV is good - not as slim as some other 40" LED but you pay for slim-nest.There isn't that many color adjustments settings - so you aren't going to get a pro-calibration if that is what you are after.The remote is plane vanilla also but we didn't get this for the remote.Overall, the picture isbeautiful in any light & doesn't look Samsung neon fake.Given that it is 40" & cost around $430 makes this a great value buy in this segment.Of course, Sony rep & Amazon fulfillment make this a winner deal all around!

Reviews.Title: fantastic
Reviews.Author: GENG YOU
Reviews.Content: Sony is always my first choice of TV. High definition and low price, that's what i'm talking about. thanks a lot

Reviews.Title: SONY KDL-40R450A 40 INCH 60HZ 1080P
Reviews.Author: KEN TELLS ALL "Perfectionist"
Reviews.Content: Bought this 40" Sony for my 82 year young Mom who wanted a larger screen, she loves it. TV is slim and light. Works fine and gives a nice clear picture in HD. Set is made out of light plastic and its guts are circuit boards and LEDs. It feels like a toy TV but it performs real well. Has only 2 HDMI ports but that is all you need if you have just a cable box and DVD. All sets today are now being made light and cheap to keep cost down. Hope it lasts at least 3 years.4/9/2013 - The TV set is still working great. Nice set at a real reasonable price - Now $492.99!7/20/2013 - TV still working great. No problems. My Mom loves it!

Reviews.Title: Chosen over Samsung for price and Clarity, awesome HDTV !
Reviews.Author: LexLas
Reviews.Content: I knew the day would come where Sony came out with a well made HDTV again. I chose this over Samsung brands, because of clarity and price. It does not have wi-fi or apps, which i luve. I can't stand all that in the bedroom. I purchased this for the bedroom. What a great hdtv, very clear, and bright. The only thing i can complain about is that it does not have an input for SVGA, so i cannot connect my computer to it ? Not sure why they left that out. Over all, a 4.5 out of 5. Great HDTV, almost perfect. This is for the person who just wants a HDTV with nothing else. Did i mention what a great price ! If you really need Apps, Netflix and such, just add a blu-ray player with it, thats easy enough.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for Amazing Price
Reviews.Author: Riken Nyodu
Reviews.Content: The make of the product is brilliant :) Totally satisfied. I didn't want to waste money on smart tv since I would be using my macbook air to connect to the tv using HDMI. And it works great. Delivery was quick too.Thank you Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Sony is BACK!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this TV and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a TV around this size.1. It's super LIGHT and THIN2. Great picture quality3. Amazing sound quality4. Nice menu and options5. REmote is small and comfortable6. It's a SONY7. The design is beautiful

Reviews.Title: Great Combination of Quality and Value
Reviews.Author: Navy Dad
Reviews.Content: I bought this model on sale from Amazon and I definitely happy I did so.Very high quality picture.  Sound is good, but I use a Sony Blu-Ray/Home Theater with the TV and that is the best way for this system.In fact, I recommend this TV as the perfect companion to a Sony Home system.For sizing, I am using this TV in a room where the viewers are 10-15 feet from the screen...this TV does very nicely for those dimensions.

Reviews.Title: needs MORE HDMI Inputs
Reviews.Author: Jagga
Reviews.Content: The TV Is very clear, but I wish it had more HDMI Ports. With everything being HDMI These days, it only has 2 ports, which I Feel is low. I bought an HDMI Switch though that allows me to hook up 4 HDMIS to one input and that seems to work great with the tv . Other then that, it is a solid tv.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Ayoub I. Kaileh
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be anymore happier even if I tried, this television is superb. I've been looking for a good flat screen for the past couple of weeks, but I really didn't care for smart or 3d features, so I went ahead and bought this 40 inch Sony television.  Right out the box you'll be given three picture options, vivid, standard and custom. What's so astonishing is that you don't even have to adjust the picture resolution, it looked amazing straight out the box. So utilizing the custom option isn't needed.With regards to the picture, it's excellent. It's crisp and clear, the contrast and the colors just pop out, and the level of detail is astounding. Plus the sound was good as well. The design is nice, sleek and slim (but not quiet as slim as other models). It has 2 HDMI inputs; so it's good for when you want more then one connection going on simultaneously. Whether you like to play video games or watch Blu rays(like me),this TV will serve those purposes. One last thing before I forget, Amazon's service was great. The TV arrived in perfect condition and on schedule. So there you have it, I highly recommend this TV!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL-40R450A 40" 60 HZ 1080p LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Review Maven
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting, low-priced version of the Sony Bravia series. It has an LED screen with motion flow at 120 HZ, a full 1080 picture, Bravia sync so you can depend on it communicating with other plugged in devices, and a variety of other useful stuff, such as:  the auto-wide option that enables the TV to choose the best size screen for different formats, and  digital media choices such as photo, music and video. The motion flow system makes the 60 HZ seem like 120, and is wonderful. And by the way it weighs an incredible 16 pounds and could be carried by most anyone. I hooked it up to my Direct TV box in five minutes and all was done. With all this, the price was what I would call low for any HD TV.Having listed some of the terrific features of the TV, there are some notable differences between it and my old Bravia XBR2. First - the actual screen material for the 40R450A seems to be a little less great than the XBR2.  I have Direct TV, which I've had for years, and with this TV, just once in a while it's not quite as silky a picture as was the XBR2, especially with SD, which the early Sony HD capable TV's were famous for. I would say it's at its top performance on nature shows, which to me look about as good as a picture can look. The auto-wide, as I said, is great -  I don't understand why anyone would disable it because it chooses the correct picture size/ratio for each show, and seems awfully handy. Of course you can override this, but not usually with very good results. The sound is ok, it doesn't seem to easily distort or anything, just lacks the desirable basses and full sound you will get with a sound bar, which I do recommend. I would think each person would want to choose their own picture settings, so won't bother to list my choices, but I will say I use lots of backlight and it seems to work extremely well.Overall, for the price this is an amazing TV. I'm loving it. I've only had it for a few weeks so will update if any problems arise, but so far I couldn't be happier with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Kelvin Dorsey
Reviews.Content: Excellent delivery and setup everything was done very well.  I am planning on ordering another Sony TV and bracket very soon.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Picture
Reviews.Author: danielsden "danielsden"
Reviews.Content: The Samsung 36" HD LCD I have had for 3 years broke completely. Bad main board. Had to have it replaced once before under warranty after just 6 months. Although I liked its bright picture, I have never had this kind of problem with a Sony. This specific Sony television has an amazingly brillant and detailed LED image. I am just astounded by the detail it brings out in movies; things I have never seen in the film before. And for the price, this is a really good deal! The only cons I would bring up is that 1) it has limited (just 2) HDMI ports, but this is generally okay with me since I only usually hook-up a DVD player, and Satellite connection. 2)The table-top stand is pretty rickety, so secure it well to any surface with a couple of drilled screw holes (unless you simply hang it with a solid bracket on the wall). I bought a 2X4, just to give it a little more height, and srewed it into that, and then secured the board against each side of a wall it sets next to. 3) The remote is fairly primitive, so don't expect a lot, although I suppose Sony assumes you will buy a more expensive "all-in-one" remote, which you should definitely budget for in this case. Other than that, wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with it!
Reviews.Author: Lorraine Kaplan
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I am not a TV geek or a gamer. I'm very happy with this TV - the size is right and the price was great.  This TV replaced a 24" flat front tube TV that weighed 85 pounds! I bought the other TV when the prices on the flat panel TVs (only plasmas then) were close to $2000.  This TV cost $450 and weighs around 17 pounds.  I don't need a lot of bells and whistles.  I have my Roku hooked up to it and HD cable.  The picture and sound are great.  I'd give it 5 stars if it had one more HDMI input.

Reviews.Title: Needs more HDMI ports!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Uyanik
Reviews.Content: Down side, only 2 HDMI ports. Not enough for gamers. I had to buy a multi HDMI switcher. But the TV works great.

Reviews.Title: Sony's Motionflow XR120 is terrible at best...
Reviews.Author: Travis Broschat
Reviews.Content: I was very excited when I ordered my TV, it was to be an upgrade from a 2007 Mitsubishi 46" LCD 120hz TV. Today my new Sony arrived, I unboxed it, it was remarkably light and easy to move around compared to my old TV. I hooked it up and instantly noticed that the picture isn't as crisp as my Mitsubishi, the default color settings appear overly bright and cartoonish (that was easily cleared up with a few adjustments). The first thing I turned on is game 1 of the NLDS baseball playoffs between the Reds and Pirates, I was very disappointed with Sony's XR120, it actually looks like they just printed a fancy name on the TV box and did nothing to the TV itself. The motion blur on this TV is more than abundant! I thought maybe a Bluray disc will be more telling, it is... the motion blur and shudder are horrible, and the picture is grainy, my brother has an RCA 120hz TV and his TV looks much better than this one, I should have bought the 50 inch Vizeo Smart TV with the same specs for $100 less... I expected more from Sony, even if it isn't their flagship line...EDIT:I discovered this evening that this TV is not 120hz as advertised by Amazon, I also realized it only has 2 HDMI inputs instead of 3 as advertised. I contacted Amazon about my disappointment and they offered me a partial refund of $213.80 if I want to keep the TV, or a full refund if I want to return it, I accepted the partial refund because at that price it is worth keeping. As disappointed as I am with the TV, I'm very happy with Amazon's customer service, they made me feel like a valued customer with their prompt response and desire to satisfy the customer. Well done Amazon, I will continue to shop with you because you did the right thing. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, incredible price for a Sony.
Reviews.Author: Michael Dorff
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a 30-inch flat-screen that died after about ten years' use.  I was amazed at the difference ten years has brought.  The picture is bright, crisp, and beautiful.  Netflix streaming never looked so good!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a competitive price.
Reviews.Author: Adrian
Reviews.Content: I planned to buy the larger and more advanced Sony KDL-47W802A 47-Inch 120Hz 1080p LED HDTV (Black) but after I realized I didn't need all its bells and whistles, I decided on the more modest 40R450A and saved myself $1000.After a few tweaks to the settings, I'm very happy with the picture. Sound is blah, and generally typical for small flat panel tvs. Blacks look great. Off axis viewing is acceptable and motion blur seems fine. Perhaps you can do better if you're prepared to pay <alot> more. This TV is replacing a Sony XBR9 that sadly failed. Prior to getting this TV, I did try a Samsung EH6000, but it just didn't work for me. I just couldn't get the picture the way I wanted it, so decided to go back to a Sony TV.I like this TV's thin bezel and using the supplied stand provides a very stable TV. It's a very nice looking TV.There's really not many feature to talk about but the Tv does support ARC and MHL and will play music, videos and pictures from USB sticks.Overall very happy with this TV and happier the money I saved.** Update **As mentioned, the TV has a special MHL style HDMI input. I used this with the new Roku 3400R Streaming Stick  (Purple). It worked perfectly, and you can continue using the TV remote control with the ROKU. Makes a very easy way to give the TV "Smart features". Audio from the ROKU can be passed back to your receiver over ARC via the TV (if you receiver supports it).Also .... If you don't like the ROKU sticking out the side of the TV, you can use a angled HDMI adapter too !

Reviews.Title: Beautiful LED TV (40" Version)
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: I love this LED TV.  I myself consider 40" more than enough, I've had 60" and viewed 80" but 40" has always been my sweet spot for viewing.  The design is nice and minimal, with by far one of the more gorgeous displays on the market in this or even above this price range.  It's used for both movies and a lot of gaming and has surpassed everything so far.

Reviews.Title: sweet rig
Reviews.Author: Nick williams
Reviews.Content: I got this 50" when it was on sale for under 600$ I was skeptical to be honest, only 2 HDMI but I ended up pairing it with a sony sound bar system, took care of lack of HDMI, im a avid gamer, and was hoping the picture and sound would be up to my standards, wow picture is awesome, sound when paired with the sound bar rocks my house, I can't believe the quality set-up I ended up with for under 1000$ total, just floored, the shipping took awhile though, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: David Cook
Reviews.Content: Really like this tv. It is nice to look at, not to mention the quality is spot on. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful picture
Reviews.Author: Marion D. Sadtler
Reviews.Content: I love Sony- great TV beautiful resolution. Replaced a smaller TV and with the slimmer edge you really get a full view

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware, warranty service is horrible!
Reviews.Author: Michael Hasen
Reviews.Content: This television is a massive disappointment.  It failed after less than 5 months.  In the last six weeks they have sent parts twice and failed to correct the problem.  Now they want to send us a "refurbished" TV. I've bought many Sony products over the years, but will never buy another one.  I pray you never need to get involved with their customer "service" organization. The amount of persistence and patience it takes to get Sony to honor their warranty obligations is ridiculous.Update - as of 11/29 we finally did get a new set from Sony. Too bad it was such an enormous pain to make it happen.

Reviews.Title: excelent tv
Reviews.Author: Luis Alfredo Maluenga
Reviews.Content: This tv is awesome, nice quality Picture and sound, i love to play on my ps3 and whatch movies on Blue ray

Reviews.Title: Sony quality
Reviews.Author: Agnusdei
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to me and I couldn't be more happier. TV. Fir me is about the quality of its picture, not the bells and whistle that comes with it. This television delivers a very good, crisp and clear picture. Vivid colors and true high definition. Even with 720p (cables and sattelite only delivers at 720) reception it delivers quality high definition. My two year old sony BDP synced well and functioned well with this Bravia. My Apple TV worked well with it as well. Easy setup and very light.

Reviews.Title: A great "early" Christmas gidt for the parents.
Reviews.Author: HAPPY SHOPPER
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my parents and they love the picture as well as the way the TV it self looks . They are in their 80s and had no problem hooking it up. Every time I talk to them they rave about the color of the picture and how clear it is.

Reviews.Title: A Workhorse TV!
Reviews.Author: Brian Mac "maccve"
Reviews.Content: Typical Sony quality...this is a no nonsense television that does what it needs to do.  It is not a "smart tv," but I already had Apple TV which does everything a smart tv would do.  I bought this to replace a TCL television that was pretty nice up until I broke off the antenna connector and it killed all the inputs...been 3 months and still waiting for the warranty service parts to show up...got tired of waiting and decided to just get this one as I know it will be good for years to come!  I did have some apprehension about this not being a true 120Hz TV, but I watch a lot of sports and I do not notice any issues and it does just fine.  The best thing is that I have an entertainment center that was custom made for an old 43" rear projection tv...this 50" tv fits in in just perfect with no space on either side!

Reviews.Title: WOW!  I compared this side by side at Costco against Samsung and Vizio
Reviews.Author: Happy r/c
Reviews.Content: Yes, I realize that the SONY model on Amazon and Costco are different but it's the same SONY tv R series.  SONY website currently only sells one 40 inch R series.When my eyes compared this 40 inch SONY side by side against Samsung, Vizio, and Sharp, there's just no comparison in picture quality.  SONY is sharper than the others and I can see the texture on the skin and the flesh tones were correct.  The other tvs showed a colored blob instead of the texture of the surface of a face.  I noticed that Samsung tvs are TOO BRIGHT (dries out my eyeballs) and they don't show the texture, detail, and flesh tone as well as the SONY.The other brands may have more bells and whistles but SONY has the best picture.  I've also been reading the reviews that the SMART tvs are not as good as a ROKU box and you'd still be ahead in saving money.Plus, SONY has the reliability.  With other brands, who wants a tv that dies right after the warranty period expires?Highly recommended.By the way, the 52 inch SONY LCD tv I bought in summer of 2008 to watch the summer Olympics in Beijing is still going strong so that's 5.5 years so far.

Reviews.Title: I like turtles
Reviews.Author: linkziz
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great value. It has very impressive picture. The sound is also very good even though i dont use it. My only complaint about it is that the normal RCA input is actually run through the comportment input. You can probably take care of that problem with just using splitters but I haven't tried because I have no need for the component input. Its not that big of a deal. I think it was designed that way to keep costs down while still putting out a high quality unit. That being said I would still buy another one in a heart beat. I'm very impressed with the TV especially for how low the cost was. I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a quality good sized TV with great picture and at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Incredible TV, Especially for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: Fantastic TV.  The picture is clear, bright and sharp. The colors are natural looking and deep.  Even the sound is very good which is surprising for a flat screen TV.  The base was easy to put together and it sturdy.  The TV itself is very light and easy to move around.  And, the price can't be beat. It is much better than TVs that cost $100-200 more (though it is not wireless nor wireless ready so be aware of this when purchasing).It is easy to set up and use.  There are little or no adjustments needed to the picture as the factory settings are very good (unlike on most other sets I have purchased). This Sony isn't a Smart TV though so for people who watch Netflix, Amazon, etc. you will need to purchase a separate adapter. This wasn't a problem for us though since this is in the bedroom where we mostly use On Demand features when not watching regular TV. Also, we have other Smart TVs in the house.  I was happy to save the money on the price by not having these features. At 40 inches it is the perfect size for a bedroom TV. This is now "the TV with the best picture in the house" according to my wife who has a much better eye for this than I do!  Sony has always made great TVs and this hasn't changed over the years.  Next time I need a TV, I will look at a Sony first.If this TV fits your size and use needs, you should buy it.  It is excellent in all respects.

Reviews.Title: Great buy love sony
Reviews.Author: Gbeninato
Reviews.Content: Great deal for sonyLove itSony always great productNeed to tweak. Settings but then great pictureNot disappointed

Reviews.Title: Great picture clarity
Reviews.Author: C. Jordan "Voyager"
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV.  My first LED so I have no basis for camparison, but the picture quality is remarkable.  True colors.

Reviews.Title: Solid Sony TV
Reviews.Author: Taylor French
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice, basic Sony TV, this is definitely your best bet. I bought both the 32" and 40" versions for my apartment because they were such a good deal! I've always been a big fan of Sony's minimalist design and high quality, and this TV series does not disappoint.While other brands' products scream "I AM A FANCY TV - LOOK AT ME!" Sony always does a good job of keeping things elegant and understated. In fact, the only thing on the bezel (other than SONY) is the energyStar certified logo. The controls are cleverly hidden in a recess on the back-right-hand side. This simplicity is also evident in the menu system, which is very easy to navigate, as well as the remote, which is laid out very intuitively with just the right amount of buttons.Picture quality is as good as I expected. I'm mostly streaming things off of my AppleTV, and I have no complaints of black levels or colors being off. I was very glad to see that this TV has a light sensor, which adjusts the TV brightness to the level of light in the room, as well as a digital optical audio out for my sound system. My only gripe is that there are only two HDMI inputs - one in the back and one on the side, but this seems to be par for the course in this price range.As a bonus, Sony Includes a USB port on the side, where you can plug in a thumb-drive or portable hard drive to play music, or view videos and pictures. In my testing, it worked pretty well. But I would highly recommend buying a $99 AppleTV if you don't want to spend a premium for a "smart tv."

Reviews.Title: Great deal on such a nice TV!
Reviews.Author: Steve Tang
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new TV to replace my budget 40 inch Samsung LCD I got two years ago on black friday. The samsung had a flickering issue and would lose picture for hours at a time, and this happened about 2 months out of warranty, so that was unfortunate. So I looked on amazon to find an affordable 40 inch replacement. I came accross this TV and saw that the reviews were great and was shocked that a TV made by Sony would cost under $500. I picked it up from my local Costco and taking out out of the box I noticed it was noticeably lighter than my old samsung LCD. The Frame around the TV is really thin and look very nice almost like it doesnt have a frame. The picture is seem perfect for me, I just popped in Toy Story 3 on bluray and was blown away by how great it look.The only con I find with this tv is that on the front there is a little glare on the bottom when light shines on it but not too big of a deal.Overall very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Man Cave TV
Reviews.Author: J Plum
Reviews.Content: Quick shipping and packed extremely well with lots of cardboard and a ton of noodle like packaging to make sure the inner box didn't move around at all.This TV is super light, SONY seems to be getting them lighter every year and I appreciate that for as we move this TV quite a bit when it's not in our Garage/Bar area this TV will be traveling each fall Saturday with us for tailgating purposes.Just a few adjustments on the settings and we had it up and running in no time.Very happy with yet another SONY HD TV!

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: Works great, clear picture, good features, affordable, and everything as advertised.Attractive design. Easy to use. Fits into small area well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture, Sound and Value
Reviews.Author: Jeff Satkin "video1452"
Reviews.Content: I was replacing a defective larger TV.  The price is great and the unit is light. Sound is better than my older unit. Picture very sharp, uhh SONY. Another major benefit is cost of use. Only $11 of electricity, lower than other models.

Reviews.Title: the God of non-Smart HDTVs.
Reviews.Author: Scheinzitivity
Reviews.Content: my top television. i did not purchase from amazon, as i like to pay for expensive things as i see them. i bought the 50 inch from pc richards for 600 and i am in love with it. it has a beautiful interface for usb file management. i also extended my warranty on it, but it seems like i will have no problems with it i hope. ive had it for a month now and i am still amazed at how it makes the 1080p quality of the ps3 and xb360 look. my tv never leaves hdmi output. overall, if you are looking for a great tv without all those retarded smart features, this is the best one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Television
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I recently received my new Sony 50' inch and was very skeptical after finding out this television was only a true 60hz and the 120hz is the "motion flow tech" (not really 120hz). I was pleasantly surprised when I started testing it with various blue rays. I saw no noticeable blur or distortion I somewhat expected from a lower end (60hz) television. I was using my PS3 for testing and even Borderlands 2 looked great during movement and fast turns.On a note that I haven't seen in reviews, the Sony controller that is supplied with the TV also works as a remote for your PS3. You can navigate the main menu, stop, pause and play your blue rays your watching on it and the whole nine yards. The only negative thing I honestly can say about this television is the high gloss screen. It reflects very badly even in a room with no windows. I have a fluorescent light in my ceiling and I can really see it glaring off the screen when its on. As a result this TV is best played in a dark setting.All in all its a great TV for a great price! Glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: Victor Benson
Reviews.Content: excellent! no complaints. i would recommend anybody to get this. Picture perfect especially with blu ray or just any device

Reviews.Title: A true Sony TV
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: When I told people I was looking for a TV everyone and their brother told me to get something else because of some useless bell or whistle.  When I said all I cared about was picture quality and color, I received no argument for SONY BRAVIAs.  It is lifelike color, good refresh (I just watched the Stanley Cup Playoffs and a fast game like hockey was gorgeous).  I bought this TV blind after my father, friends, friends parents all have bought them and loved them.  Buy this and other SONY BRAVIA TVs.

Reviews.Title: Motion Blur
Reviews.Author: scott panton
Reviews.Content: I just bought this off of a friend,I don't have cable but I have it running off of my computer, haven't noticed any motion blur watching HD action movies,it could your cable company. Reviews.Title: Love it....
Reviews.Author: Carole
Reviews.Content: After much thought and reading Amazon reviews which are amazingly helpful, I bought this TV yesterday.  I'm not a techie and in fact get anxious about things electronic.....I'm over 70 and just don't like to deal with all the cables and wires and calibrating and doo-hickies and etc.  So....I was nervous.I carried it to the car by myself since its so light, got a friend to help me attach the base with the two screws provided, plugged in the HDM1 cable, walked the dog for an hour, came back and hit a few buttons and it worked perfectly.  Today, I got Direct TV to help me program their remote to my new, beautiful TV and am a happy Senior.  I just hope it lasts longer than the five years my $1000. Samsung did which is why I didn't want to buy another one.As an aside, looking at one of these reviews, my Samsung did not have a Samsung panel.  I don't know what kind it was.Just as a point of information, the Samsung is only the third TV I've owned.  The first two lasted me years and years and I expected much more from Samsung.  Maybe the new products just don't last as long.  One person told me 2 to 5 years; another 10 to 15 yrs. so who knows.  I hope this Sony lasts me for the rest of my life.

Reviews.Title: The best midsize tv for those wanting great picture,  solid design, and simple operation.
Reviews.Author: Ben Fuller
Reviews.Content: This is the first time buying a tv for myself and I can say after 6 months of use that this tv was the perfect choice.Big TVs might be some peoples piece of pie but I've never wanted to crane my neck to view the edges of the screen. I started my search looking for a tv between 36 and 45 inches for less than $500.Some tvs might have a great picture, but they are are marred by a cheap design with a flimsy frame and an unsteady stand. Out of the box Sony's 40 inch LED TV has a sexy and sleek design. The border is super thin at not even 3/4" thick and even though its plastic it feels and looks solid. The base is also solid, it is short keeping the screen safely low to the table, and it is wide, almost as wide as the screen itself leaving no room to wobble.The picture quality is excellent when the settings are correct (guides can be found on the web). As a plus the presets can be individually customised. Once I found a setting I liked the picture has great color and contrast with pristine details. I am currently using an xbox 360 hooked up with the hd component cables that came with it, a samsung smart bluray player, and a digital antenna. They all give me equally great picture.This is not a smart tv meaning no internet and no video services but honestly this is an unnecessary extra when all of the applications I need can be found on xbox or installed to my bluray player.If you search for a professional review the only thing they complain about is the viewing angle. My tv is in the corner and when I sit  near the wall to either side the blacks arent quite as dark but it wont be noticeable to the  average person.Overall this tv is a great for anyone wanting a medium sized, great quality, inexpensive tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Len S.
Reviews.Content: Easy set up - great picture - just what I was looking for in a bedroom.  I'm a Sony TV fan.

Reviews.Title: Analog audio out is 1/8inch, not RCA.
Reviews.Author: Joshua Chase
Reviews.Content: The TV looks great.  I bought it for my elderly Aunt and Uncle.  My only complaint is that it says that there is an RCA audio out on the back, so I was very confused.  The audio out does look like an RCA plug, but black.  I plugged an RCA cable into it and nothing came out.  I searched everywhere for the answer.  Then somewhere I discovered that the output is actually an 1/8 inch plug that looks remarkably like an RCA plug.  Just thought I'd mention it so if anyone has the same problem they can see this simple solution.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the price.
Reviews.Author: J. Roberts
Reviews.Content: Decent TV.  Sounds a bit tinny but but you can change it a bit.  One HDMI input is pointing out the back instead of down so mounting on a wall required the use of 90 degree angle adapters. (Cable Matters Degree Female Adapter  The only other one is on the side so it sticks out a bit making it difficult to truly 'hide' all the cables for a clean mount.  I wish it had more HDMI inputs and they all pointed down from the back of the set.  But picture is good, sound is ok.  For the price, it's a keeper.

Reviews.Author: Julie Quad
Reviews.Content: This was our first flat screen purchase. Love the tv, but it was not compatible with the "universal" tilt/swivel mount by Sanus Model VMF518. The mounting threads on this tv are a 100x200 mm configuration which is too narrow for this mount. Sanus recommended model VLF410 which worked great instead.

Reviews.Content: The TV set up was great right out of the box and picture quality great!  We don't have HD hooked up to it yet and it looks clear with no hook up! The price for this set was really a great deal,  but just got it so will keep you posted if it still works after a couple months.

I have my PS3 slim attached with the tv and have watched Inception on it in complete awe :) It doesnt swivel but it really doesnt need to the brightness is also a plus because everybody knows when im watching tv in my neighborhood lol. I give this a 5 star all the way and its definitely a tv I will keep for minimum 7 years. I havent even cranked the sound up past 30 yet because its just so loud by that point already. Reviews.Title: Excellent, plain TV
Reviews.Author: G. A.
Reviews.Content: This 2013 state-of-the-art, backlit television is a no frill 40 inch television. If you want a TV with a USB and two HDMI inputs at a fair discounted price, this is it. At this time it is the only 40", 2013 SONY model made. The picture quality is excellent. You would not know that it is a 60 hz set. The enhancement works and no motion problem in speedy action is noticeable. This is not a "smart" TV but who needs it? Buy an outboard unit to bring in WiFi programs if you desire. It is still cheaper and better to do so. It is very light and easy to wall-mount. I have had it for over four months, used it daily and am pleased with the daylight and nightlight viewing.

Reviews.Title: Returned Samsung for this Sony 40 inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: Garland Fairchild
Reviews.Content: I originally bought a Samsung TV set because of the picture quality that seems to be the best when I visited the local store, but when I got home with one and tried to assemble it, my buyer's remorse took over.First of all, the Samsung TV set from the back side really seems to have cheap quality plastic, I usually don't mind things of such nature much but it was quite noticeable how different it was from all the Sony products I have owned before.Next, the way the stand was designed was just poor, it's basically held together by 2 tiny screws from the side but the weight of the screen made it tilt forward slightly, which is simply not going to work.So I returned the Samsung TV set and got the Sony one, and couldn't be happier, the plastic is high quality and fit and finish is simply better. Samsung may have the best picture quality but honestly, after watching some tv on my new Sony TV set, I have no complaints about picture quality at all, HD content is excellent.I also prefer the simple and elegant Sony interface over Samsung's cartoon-ish interface, and Sony tv set doesn't make annoying sound when turned on and off like Samsung tv does.If you use USB sticks to watch video like I do, it might annoy you that Sony only supports MPEG1 and MPEG2 formats, but you can always convert file-types on PC. If you already own a Blu-Ray player, it probably has a USB port that supports all kinds of file types anyways.I think 40 inch is a sweet spot for TVs, because you can either sit up close without noticing pixels on the screen, or sit far back and yet not feel like the screen size is too small. Being able to get a 40 inch SONY brand HDTV set under $450 sounds like a dream, one of the best money spent in years.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: This TV is great.  It plays standard definition cable TV (480i) really well.  Full definition video (1080p) from my DVD player also looks great.  Picture quality is very good.  I have had trouble finding a TV that works well at 480i.  Blowing up standard def cable to 40 inches will cost you some picture quality, but on this TV the picture quality is still good.  I have this TV hooked up to a surround sound AV system via HDMI and optical audio, plus a blue ray DVD player.  I've had no problems.  I have not tested the internal speakers.  Setup is easy, but I think the stand could be more solid. Once again Sony proves its self as a good company.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia TV's Are Unmatched in Quality
Reviews.Author: Douglas R. Lyon
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this TV I had done as always extensive online research (i.e. consumer reports.com and Amazon.com and etc.) This 40" TV was for my kitchen. It has a great picture and works well mounted. I own two other Sony Bravia TV's a 55W900A...just purchased a week ago (this TV is discontinued...if your'e lucky B&H; may still have a few remaining. Its ratings are off the chart). Its the best class 55' on the market. I also have an older Bravia 52" XBR that I purchased in 2008. Its picture quality is as good today as the day I bought. The reason I mention all this extra information is that Sony's TV components are great and as a TV brand they are still unmatched. They are pricer than Samsung (which has nice TV's as well). You can get bigger picture TVs from brands like Sharp, Pioneer, and Vizio for the price, but Sony TV's are the top of the line...just read the amazon reviews. If price is your bottom line Sony is not the TV for you but if Quality is them look no further. P.S. the reason I didn't purchase the TV's from amazon is that they either were out of stock or didn't have them in the time framed needed. Thanks DRL

Turn off any accelerations or any of that crap and watch a BluRay, and you'll be sold. All those motion enhancement features should be banned by law. You don't need any of it. It only has 2 hdmi ports, I would have preferred 3 but for the price, I can't complain. The sound quality is actually fairly good. At night/early morning I have to turn the volume down to about 1 or 2. Anything over 4 will wake my roommate, anything over 8 will get me a knock on the wall at 2 and 3 in the morning.  Overall I'd say this is a great purchase. Worth every penny. The shipping was fast and it arrived just as you would buy from Walmart or Best Buy. A Sony TV box with no extra protection. Luckily the delivery company decided to be gentle with it.

I read that the new Bose sound bar did not really sound that good for the high price.

Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: I bought a Sony KDL-40R450A 40 inch LED HDTV but after many hours trying to tweak the picture I finally gave up and returned it. It had an unacceptable clear (albeit faint) outline around most images. The "fine print" at the bottom of ads was blurry and unreadable but the worst was football games. When there was a close-up of the players the picture actually looked pretty good. Colors are this TV's strong suit. However, when the teams began each play the scene was not at all good (not for an HDTV). Players were out of focus and colors looked "strained". If you set at least 9 to 10 feet away from the screen the ill effects lessen ... you could probably deal with it. But my thought was why the heck should I? I spent only a hundred and fifty bucks more and bought an LG 47LN5700. The difference is night and day. Without exaggeration I have never seen a better picture. I haven't even had to change the factory settings. This is a "smart" TV but if you do not want to get involved with those extra features you don't have to. The picture is simply spectacular. The players on field look great now at any distance. I can read the finest print with ease and the evening news anchor looks like he's sitting in my room. No joke!Amazon has a great price on this highly touted model ... it'll be the best decision you'll make this year. [...]LG Electronics 47LN5700 47-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED-LCD HDTV with Smart TV

Reviews.Title: Poor Sony TV, poor Sony CS, limited Amazon returns!
Reviews.Author: Andrew A. Klee "hector"
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon 2 months ago and had problems with its digital audio optical out line when hooked up to a brand new Denon E-300 AVR.  After listening to the audio through the receiver for a couple hours, the audio cuts out.  I assumed it the problem was with the Denon receiver because I could still get the audio through the small Sony speakers.  Denon CS couldn't figure it out so I returned that new receiver to Fry's B&M.;  Last week I bought a Pioneer VSX-8231 AVR here at Amazon and hooked it up yesterday.  I now have the same problem!!  After "chatting" online with Sony CS, they could not figure it out.  I called there CS on the phone and they determined it was a faulty TV!  Since this the elapsed from purchase to problem diagnosis, Sony will on swap it out with a refurb only!  Amazon won't allow a return because of the time lapsed either.  I will never buy a Sony again, and am thinking about returning my Pioneer receiver to Amazon too.  This whole ordeal has been a nightmare!  I bought this Sony over a Vizio because I thought they sold quality products.  Wrong!  And to make matters worst, the CS sucks too!  I will simply purchase from Costco from here on out.  The few dollars I saved with Amazon and Sony was simply no worth effing hassles!12/4/13 UPDATE:  After speaking to Sony's "Customer Relations" they asked that I fax a copy of my receipt to them.  I scanned and emailed it along with a prolonged explanation.  Two days later they just called and said they are going to send me a new tv along with a return label for an old one!  I bumped my review up to three stars because of this and assuming the new tv works properly I might bump it up to 4.  Actually, I like the picture quality and the slim design, but this has been a frustrating ordeal.12/14/13 Update:  I finally received my replacement TV.  However, between Sony and FedEx, it did not arrive when my initial notification stated it would, therefore I burned time off work waiting for it.  Of course switching out the two TVs was a hassle since my first one was mounted on the wall.  Additionally, the return packaging was a PIA.  Their detailed instructions were for not.  Their glued-up multi-piece foam rubber pieces that were hot-melted together fell apart, therefore it was a frustrating jigsaw puzzle packing this up.  I have it ready to return to FedEx and hope it arrives safe and sound so Sony doesn't charge my credit card.  I am tempted to bump this down to two stars but at least Sony gave me a new TV.  However, the whole 3 month ordeal has been a nightmare!  BTW, I noticed this TV is made in Mexico.  I would not buy this TV again.

Reviews.Title: NO PIC initially with many blu - ray discs
Reviews.Author: David B. Wallace "BrianInOrbit"
Reviews.Content: using a Sony BDP - S185 (has latest update) and using HDMI 1 input (even though this same disc player functions "normally" on a 5 year older Sony  Bravia 1080i), however, with the newer KDL-40R450A some blu - ray titles when i initially load the player i will get only sound but no picture and i have to change the inputs to eventually go back to HDMI 1 to be able to see a picture OR turn the tv on and off to see a blu - ray picture. I have found that if i "wait approximately a minute"  and go ahead and start loading the blu ray player but still stay on tv input  BEFORE switching to HDMI 1 input that i can sometimes see the previews and pop up menu BUT with some discs (i.e. Jack the Giant Slayer and Phantom of the Opera 1943 for example) even when i do that  when i finally enter "play" to begin the actual movie i once again get sound but no picture and have to again toggle through the inputs or turn tv set off and back on & since the blu - ray player is still playing when i do this i then finally see the actual movie. THIS IS NUTS!. I have owned the set for over 3 months and have primarily used it for cable and watching many standard dvd films with a different dvd player using the tv's composite input and everything has acted normally (sound is fairly mediocre though). I recently started purchasing more BLU - Ray discs and have to go through this "ordeal" with many of them (even though this same player acts normal with an older bravia). So i am therefore thinking it is something to do with this newest Sony tv. I have a large film  & music library and with standard dvd players have had the great option of using the repeat feature on the remote to have the film or music videos play continuously (video "wallpaper"). It seems that this great option is being either dropped from many blu - ray players and/or the blu - ray discs themselves often wont allow "repeat" although many standard dvds and players do allow repeat. Thats a shame. I didnt totally figure out this blu - ray playback "quirk" till after my warranty has expired a short while ago since i didnt have alot of blu ray discs and i thought at first it was the player acting "goofy" but now i think its the tv acting "goofy".  Any help is appreciated. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Compared side by side with samsung UN40EH5300 model
Reviews.Author: Jithesh T.
Reviews.Content: I had purchased Samsung UN40EH5300 smart TV almost a month ago. Initially had some buffering problem for the youtube app, but all the other apps worked fine. Yesterday the tv hanged, and was not opening any app saying not connected to internet ("ERROR_MODEL_BIND"). I had 2 laptops and a smartphone connected to internet without any problem, and tried with LAN connection too! Nothing worked. Called up Amazon support who were very helpful in diagnosing and then they forwarded to Samsung tech support who just said the problem is with internet provider. I decided to return the Samsung TV.Now i had to have a new TV immediately. Thought of buying higher 40" model from Samsung/LG (with dual core processors). Headed to Frys today. There, they took me to compare Samsung 40" 5300 and Sony40" KDL 450A with two USB sticks. USB sticks had some pictures, including the one multiple shades of each color. The photos looked stunningly accurate in Sony, but was not accurate in Samsung. for the different shades, samsung seemed to have color blindness while the Sony showed the colors differently! Wow! They suggested i but a blue ray player + Sony KDL450A so that can get good TV + dedicated player for streaming/media. I had not thought about that! Said lemme do some research and get back! by 6:30 in the evening today i went back and bought Sony KDL450A(Frys have a good discount on this model, ~50$ less than next best price in the internet) + Sony BDP-S5100 blue ray player. Was very happy that i got a good deal.Came home, hooked up the new TV. My kid was watching Pingu on Samsung 5300 (through youtube, it occasionally works now), and I put Pingu on the new Sony TV through Sony blue ray player's youtube app. Lo!! The picture looked washed on Sony! There were pixelations here and there. Samsung had better smooth picture, while Sony's was grainy and washed. I spent more than an hour to change settings on the Sony TV and blue ray player to get a better picture! nothing worked. Tried different videos on both the TVs - a movie, music video etc. Everywhere, Sony's clarity was bad compared to Samsungs! Sony had better sharpness, but looks like the video processing engine is not good in Sony! So it will be going back to Frys soon. Samsung is returning to Amazon tomorrow. Now I am looking at Vizio M401i-A3 40". Do comment if you people have any suggestions for a good VFM 40" TV (preferably with smart capabilities)

Reviews.Title: So far glad I didn't pay for it
Reviews.Author: G. Salvas
Reviews.Content: So everything here says this tv is LED, and it is lightweight like an LED tv. However everything in the box (manual etc.) indicates it is LCD. In fact there is nothing other than the marketing on the box that says LED. I won this so I can't really complain, hey a free tv is a free tv right? But it seems misleading, and had I paid $400+ for this I'd be upset about that. Even the Amazon information says it is LED. The sticker on the box with the model number says in very small print LCD tv. Adding to the confusion they market it like a smart tv when it's really not. It's "smartphone compatible" which I guess means you can plug your smartphone into it via a wire. I have a Roku and had been told I wouldn't need it anymore, that isn't true. this tv cannot stream wireless signal.I don't have HD cable and don't have an HDTV antenna. This tv is replacing a Sharp Aquos from 2008 and so far I have to say the picture on this is worse. The color is weird and so far I haven't been able to find an adjustment for it other than presets that don't make it better. In all fairness I only installed it last night and haven't read through the full manual. In 2008 the HD technology was still new and had not been adopted by the majority so it may just be that the Sharp was somehow optimized for use without it, while today's tvs assume most people have it so they don't bother? An HD antenna will be my next purchase to see if this TV can be improved. I really hope it helps as so far it's been a disappointing win.Update -As some have educated me now, all of these tvs are LCD, it's just the backlighting being done by LED. Anyway I did get an HDMI cable and it improved picture quality tremendously. I'd stick to my original review in that you don't want to buy this TV if you don't have some sort of HD capability, the picture is just unwatchable without the HDMI cable.Also want to add that I've noticed a strange habit of the TV...There is a horizontal rolling effect going on sometimes...like being underwater. maybe a techie here can shed some light on that. It happens on HD programs (that is all I've been watching since the addition of the HDMI cable).
